source.d662d1d6:
# Using Camelot

import camelot

file = "https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/working-examples/pdf-table/table.pdf" # path to the PDF file

tables = camelot.read_pdf(file)

print('Total tables found: {}'.format(tables.n)) # print first table as pandas dataframe
source.39def463:
# tables as Dataframe

df = tables[0].df

df.head()
source.360090fd:
tables[0].to_csv("foo.csv") # export as CSV with a directory path

tables[0].to_excel("foo.xlsx") # export as Excel with a directory path

import tabula as tb

tables = tb.read_pdf('https://aclanthology.org/2020.coling-main.82.pdf', pages='all')
source.8f1834c2: tables[1].to_csv('foo.csv') # exporting to CSV with directory path

source.33708920:
# Problem Statement
    
**Primary Goal:** Convert data from PDF to Tabular format 
    
**Secondary Goal:**
    Create an API which converts PDF data into Excel Sheet
source.7c40d88a:
**Notes about Camelot:** * When not to use:
Camelot only works with text-based PDFs and not scanned documents. (As Tabula explains, “If you can click and drag to select text in your table in a PDF viewer, then your PDF is text-based”.)[2]
